ul.li1: 1“Arise, shine! For your light has come,
ul.li2: and the glory of Yahweh has risen on you.
ul.li1: 2For look! darkness shall cover the earth,
ul.li2: and thick darkness the peoples,
ul.li1: butOr “and” Yahweh will rise on you,
ul.li2: and his glory will appear over you.
ul.li1: 3And nations shall come to your light,
ul.li2: and kings to the bright light of your sunrise.
ul.li1: 4Lift up your eyes all around and see!
ul.li2: All of them gather; they come to you.
ul.li1: Your sons shall come from afar,
ul.li2: and your daughters shall be looked after on the hip.
ul.li1: 5Then you shall see
ul.li2: and you shall be radiant;
ul.li1: and your heart shall tremble
ul.li2: and open itself wide,
ul.li1: because the abundance of the sea shall fall upon you;
ul.li2: the wealth of the nations shall come to you.
ul.li1: 6A multitude of camels shall cover you,
ul.li2: the young male camels of Midian and Ephah.
ul.li1: All those from Sheba shall come;
ul.li2: they shall bring gold and frankincense,
ul.li3: and they shall proclaim the praise of Yahweh.
ul.li1: 7All the flocks of Kedar shall be gathered to you;
ul.li2: the rams of Nebaioth shall serve you.
ul.li1: They shall present a sacrifice for favor on my altar,
ul.li2: and I will glorify my honorable house.Literally “house of my honor”
ul.li1: 8Who are these? They fly like a cloud,
ul.li2: and like doves to their coops.
ul.li1: 9Because the coastlands wait for me,
ul.li2: and the ships of Tarshish are first
ul.li1: to bring your children from afar,
ul.li2: their silver and gold with them,
ul.li1: for the name of Yahweh your God,
ul.li2: and for the holy one of Israel, because he has glorified you.
ul.li1: 10And foreignersLiterally “sons of a foreign country” shall build your walls,
ul.li2: and their kings shall serve you,
ul.li1: for in my anger I struck you,
ul.li2: butOr “and” in my favor I have taken pity on you.
ul.li1: 11And your gates shall continually be open,
ul.li2: day and night they shall not be shut,
ul.li1: to bring you the wealth of nations,
ul.li2: and their kings shall be led.
ul.li1: 12For the nation and the kingdom that will not serve you shall perish,
ul.li2: and the nations shall be utterly devastated.
ul.li1: 13The glory of Lebanon shall come to you;
ul.li2: the cypress, the plane, and the pine together,
ul.li1: to glorify the place of my sanctuary,
ul.li2: and I will do honor to the place of my feet.
ul.li1: 14And the children of those who oppressed you shall come to you bending low,
ul.li2: and all those who treated you disrespectfully shall bow down at the soles of your feet.
ul.li1: And they shall call you the city of Yahweh,
ul.li2: Zion of the holy one of Israel.
ul.li1: 15Instead of you being forsaken
ul.li2: and hated with no one passing through,Or “and there is not one who passes through”
ul.li1: I will makeLiterally “place” you an everlasting object of pride,Literally “pride”
ul.li2: a joy of coming generations.Literally “generation and generation”
ul.li1: 16And you shall suck the milk of nations,
ul.li2: and suck the breast of kings,
ul.li1: and you shall know that I am Yahweh your Savior,
ul.li2: and your Redeemer, the Strong One of Jacob.
ul.li1: 17Instead of bronze I will bring gold,
ul.li2: and instead of iron I will bring silver,
ul.li1: and instead of wood, bronze,
ul.li2: and instead of stones, iron.
ul.li1: And I will appointLiterally “put” peace as your overseer,
ul.li2: and righteousness as your ruling body.Literally “they who force you to work”
ul.li1: 18Violence shall no longer be heard in your land;
ul.li2: devastation orOr “and” destruction on your borders.
ul.li1: And you shall call your walls Salvation,
ul.li2: and your gates, Praise.
ul.li1: 19The sun shall no longer be your light by day,
ul.li2: and for bright light the moon shall not give you light,
ul.li1: butOr “and” Yahweh will be your everlasting light,
ul.li2: and your God your glory.
ul.li1: 20Your sun shall no longer go down,
ul.li2: and your moon shall not wane,Literally “be taken away”
ul.li1: for Yahweh himself will be your everlasting light,
ul.li2: and your days of mourning shall come to an end.
ul.li1: 21And all your people shall be righteous;
ul.li2: they shall take possession of the land forever,
ul.li1: the shoot of hisThe reading tradition (Qere) has “my” planting,
ul.li2: the work of my hands, to show my glory.
ul.li1: 22The small one shall become a tribe,
ul.li2: and the smallest one a mighty nation.

chapter.p: I am Yahweh; I will hasten it in its time.”
